title: M4: Logs and Analysis
description: Epic: Implement flight log import, playback, charting, and export. TLOG and BIN format support. Timeline scrubbing tied to map and telemetry widgets. Core charts and CSV export. Exit criteria: pilot can review a flight log with timeline and metrics.

title: Timeline playback UI
description: Frontend timeline/scrubber component for log playback. Features: (1) horizontal timeline bar showing flight duration, (2) play/pause button, (3) speed selector (0.5x, 1x, 2x, 4x), (4) click-to-seek on timeline, (5) current timestamp display, (6) drag scrubber handle. Should emit seek/play/pause/speed commands to the Rust playback engine. Integrates into the log review view.

title: BIN log parser (ArduPilot DataFlash)
description: Add an ArduPilot .bin (DataFlash) log parser. BIN files use a binary format with FMT message definitions followed by typed data records. Should parse: FMT definitions, MSG/ATT/GPS/BARO/RCIN/RCOU/BAT/etc message types. Expose as timestamped records with named fields. Can live in mavkit (behind ardupilot feature gate) or as a separate crate. Lower priority than TLOG since TLOG is more universal.

title: Log browser UI
description: Frontend component for browsing imported logs. Shows a list/table of imported log files with: filename, date, duration, vehicle type, file size. Click to open a log for playback/analysis. Include import button (triggers file picker). Consider a LogsPanel component similar to MissionPanel/ConfigPanel pattern.

title: Log import and indexing in Tauri shell
description: Add Tauri IPC commands for log file management: (1) import_log - accept file path, detect format (TLOG/BIN), parse header/metadata (duration, date, vehicle type), store index, (2) list_logs - return indexed logs with metadata, (3) delete_log - remove from index. Use tauri-plugin-dialog for file picker. Store log index in app data dir (JSON or SQLite). Events: log://import_progress for large files.
close_reason: Log import/indexing integrated into Tauri shell with 4 commands, TS bridge, React hook, and LogsPanel UI

title: Log playback engine (Rust)
description: Implement a log playback engine in the Tauri shell or as a mavkit feature. Reads a parsed TLOG and replays messages at configurable speed (1x, 2x, 0.5x, etc). Features: play, pause, seek to timestamp, speed control. Emits the same telemetry/vehicle/home events as live connection so the existing frontend widgets work without changes. Should use a separate event namespace (e.g. playback:// prefix or a mode flag) so it doesn't conflict with live telemetry.

title: Mobile polish: BT permissions and hardware testing
description: Verify and fix Bluetooth permission flow on Android 12+ devices. Test full connection lifecycle on real hardware (BLE radio + Classic SPP). Ensure permission denied states are handled gracefully in UI. May require updates to the permission request flow in use-vehicle.ts and the Kotlin plugin.

title: Frontend test baseline (Vitest)
description: Set up Vitest for the React frontend. Add test infrastructure: (1) vitest config integrated with Vite, (2) testing-library/react for component tests, (3) initial test coverage for hooks (use-vehicle, use-params, use-mission), (4) IPC bridge module tests with mocked invoke/listen. Goal is to establish patterns, not 100% coverage.

title: Map integration for log playback
description: During log playback, show the vehicle's position on the MissionMap component. Reuse existing map infrastructure: (1) vehicle position marker moving along the flight path, (2) flight trail/track line showing where the vehicle has been, (3) optionally show the full flight path as a faded line. The existing telemetry event listeners should mostly work if the playback engine emits compatible events.

title: TLOG parser in mavkit
description: Add a TLOG (telemetry log) reader to mavkit. TLOG files are binary MAVLink message streams with timestamps (8-byte usec timestamp prefix per message). The parser should: (1) read .tlog files and yield timestamped MAVLink messages, (2) support seeking by timestamp for scrubbing, (3) expose an async iterator or stream API. This is the foundation for log playback - everything else depends on it. May require a mavkit release.

title: Log data export (CSV)
description: Export log data to CSV format. User selects which fields to export and time range, then downloads a .csv file. Use tauri-plugin-dialog for save location. Straightforward once the log parsing and indexing is in place.

title: Time-series chart component
description: Add a charting component for flight log analysis. Use a lightweight charting library (e.g. uPlot for performance, or Recharts for simplicity). Features: (1) plot any numeric telemetry field over time, (2) multi-series support (e.g. altitude + throttle), (3) linked cursor with timeline scrubber, (4) zoom/pan on time axis, (5) field selector to pick which data to chart. This is the core analysis tool for log review.

title: TLOG recording during live connection
description: Record all incoming MAVLink messages to a .tlog file during a live vehicle connection. Uses mavkit TlogWriter and Vehicle::raw_messages() broadcast channel. Includes TlogRecorderHandle in Rust, 3 Tauri commands (recording_start/stop/status), TypeScript IPC bridge, useRecording React hook, recording bar in LogsPanel, and pulsing red dot indicator in TopBar.
close_reason: Implemented: TlogRecorderHandle + 3 Tauri commands + TS bridge + useRecording hook + LogsPanel recording bar + TopBar indicator. mavkit switched to git main for TlogWriter and raw_messages() APIs.
